00138 #define arg_RENAME4 op->nfs_argop4_u.oprename
00139 #define res_RENAME4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.oprename
00140 
00141 int nfs4_op_rename(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
00142                      compound_data_t   * data,
00143                      struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
00144 {
00145     cache_entry_t  * dst_entry ;
00146     cache_entry_t  * src_entry ;
00147     cache_entry_t  * tst_entry_dst ;
00148     cache_entry_t  * tst_entry_src ;
00149     cache_entry_t  * new_entry_entry ;
00150     cache_entry_t  * old_entry_entry ;
00151 
00152     fsal_attrib_list_t    attr_dst ;
00153     fsal_attrib_list_t    attr_src ;
00154     fsal_attrib_list_t    new_attr ;
00155     fsal_attrib_list_t    old_attr ;
00156     fsal_attrib_list_t    attr_tst_dst ;
00157     fsal_attrib_list_t    attr_tst_src ;
00158 
00159     uint64_t        idnew ;
00160     uint64_t        idold ;
00161 
00162     cache_inode_status_t cache_status ;
00163 
00164     fsal_status_t fsal_status ;
00165 
00166     fsal_handle_t * handlenew ;
00167     fsal_handle_t * handleold ;
00168 
00169     fsal_name_t oldname ;
00170     fsal_name_t newname ;
00171     
00172     nfsstat4 error ;
00173     
00174     char            funcname[] = "nfs4_op_rename" ;
00175     
00176     resp->resop = NFS4_OP_RENAME ;
00177     res_RENAME4.status =  NFS4_OK  ;
00178 
00179     /* If there is no FH */
00180     if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Empty( &(data->currentFH  ) ) )
00181       {
00182         res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_NOFILEHANDLE ;
00183         return res_RENAME4.status ;
00184       }
00185   
00186     /* If the filehandle is invalid */
00187     if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Invalid( &(data->currentFH ) ) )
00188       {
00189         res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
00190         return res_RENAME4.status ;
00191       }
00192     
00193     /* Tests if the Filehandle is expired (for volatile filehandle) */
00194     if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Expired( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00195       {
00196         res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_FHEXPIRED ;
00197         return res_RENAME4.status ;
00198       }
00199 
00200     /* If there is no FH */
00201     if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Empty( &(data->savedFH  ) ) )
00202       {
00203         res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_NOFILEHANDLE ;
00204         return res_RENAME4.status;
00205       }
00206   
00207     /* If the filehandle is invalid */
00208     if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Invalid( &(data->savedFH ) ) )
00209       {
00210         res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
00211         return res_RENAME4.status ;
00212       }
00213     
00214     /* Tests if the Filehandle is expired (for volatile filehandle) */
00215     if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Expired( &(data->savedFH) ) )
00216       {
00217         res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_FHEXPIRED ;
00218         return res_RENAME4.status ;
00219       }
00220 
00221     /* Pseudo Fs is explictely a Read-Only File system */
00222     if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Pseudo(  &(data->currentFH) ) )
00223       {
00224         res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_ROFS ;
00225         return res_RENAME4.status ;
00226       }
00227 
00228     /* If data->exportp is null, a junction from pseudo fs was traversed, credp and exportp have to be updated */
00229     if( data->pexport == NULL )
00230       {
00231         if( ( error = nfs4_SetCompoundExport( data ) ) != NFS4_OK )
00232           {
00233             res_RENAME4.status = error ;
00234             return res_RENAME4.status ;
00235           }
00236       }
00237 
00238     /* Read oldname and newname from uft8 strings, if one is empty then returns NFS4ERR_INVAL */
00239     if( ( arg_RENAME4.oldname.utf8string_len  == 0 )  || ( arg_RENAME4.newname.utf8string_len == 0 ) )
00240       {
00241         res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00242         return NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00243       }
00244 
00245     /* Read oldname and newname from uft8 strings, if one is empty then returns NFS4ERR_INVAL */
00246     if( ( arg_RENAME4.oldname.utf8string_len  > FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN )  || ( arg_RENAME4.newname.utf8string_len  > FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN ) )
00247       {
00248         res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_NAMETOOLONG ;
00249         return NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00250       }
00251 
00252     /* get the names from the RPC input */
00253     if( ( cache_status = cache_inode_error_convert( FSAL_buffdesc2name( (fsal_buffdesc_t *)&arg_RENAME4.oldname, 
00254                                                                         &oldname ) ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00255       {
00256         res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00257         return res_RENAME4.status ;
00258       }
00259    
00260     if( ( cache_status = cache_inode_error_convert( FSAL_buffdesc2name( (fsal_buffdesc_t *)&arg_RENAME4.newname,
00261                                                                         &newname ) ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00262       {
00263         res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00264         return res_RENAME4.status ;
00265       }
00266     
00267    /* Sanuty check: never rename to '.' or '..' */
00268    if( !FSAL_namecmp( &newname, &FSAL_DOT ) || !FSAL_namecmp( &newname, &FSAL_DOT_DOT )  )
00269      {
00270         res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_BADNAME ;
00271         return res_RENAME4.status ;
00272      }
00273  
00274    /* Sanuty check: never rename to '.' or '..' */
00275    if( !FSAL_namecmp( &oldname, &FSAL_DOT ) || !FSAL_namecmp( &oldname, &FSAL_DOT_DOT )  )
00276      {
00277         res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_BADNAME ;
00278         return res_RENAME4.status ;
00279      }
00280  
00281     /*
00282      * This operation renames 
00283      *             - the object in directory pointed by savedFH, named arg_RENAME4.oldname
00284      *       into
00285      *             - an object in directory pointed by currentFH, named arg_RENAME4.newname
00286      *
00287      * Because of this, we will use 2 entry and we have verified both currentFH and savedFH */
00288 
00289     /* No Cross Device */
00290     if( ((file_handle_v4_t *)(data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_val))->exportid != ((file_handle_v4_t *)(data->savedFH.nfs_fh4_val))->exportid )
00291       {
00292         res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_XDEV ;
00293         return  res_RENAME4.status ;
00294       }
00295 
00296     /* destination must be a directory */
00297     dst_entry = data->current_entry ;
00298 
00299     if( data->current_filetype != DIR_BEGINNING && data->current_filetype != DIR_CONTINUE )
00300       {
00301         res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_NOTDIR ;
00302         return res_RENAME4.status ;
00303       }
00304 
00305     /* Convert saved FH into a vnode */
00306     src_entry = data->saved_entry ;
00307 
00308     /* Source must be a directory */
00309     if( data->saved_filetype != DIR_BEGINNING && data->saved_filetype != DIR_CONTINUE )
00310       {
00311         res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_NOTDIR ;
00312         return res_RENAME4.status ;
00313       }
00314 
00315     /* Renaming a file to himself is allowed, returns NFS4_OK */
00316     if( src_entry == dst_entry )
00317       {
00318         if( !FSAL_namecmp( &oldname, &newname ) )
00319           {
00320              res_RENAME4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00321              return res_RENAME4.status ;
00322           }
00323       }
00324 
00325     
00326     /* For the change_info4, get the 'change' attributes for both directories */
00327     if( ( cache_status = cache_inode_getattr( src_entry, 
00328                                               &attr_src,
00329                                               data->ht,
00330                                               data->pclient,
00331                                               data->pcontext,
00332                                               &cache_status ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00333       {
00334         res_RENAME4.status = nfs4_Errno( cache_status ) ;
00335         return  res_RENAME4.status ;
00336       }
00337     
00338 
00339 #ifdef BUGAZOMEU 
00340     /* Ne devrait pas se produire dans le cas de exportid differents */
00341 
00342     /* Both object must resides on the same filesystem, return NFS4ERR_XDEV if not */
00343     if( attr_src.va_rdev != attr_dst.va_rdev )
00344       {
00345         res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_XDEV ;
00346         return res_RENAME4.status ;
00347       }
00348 #endif
00349     /* Lookup oldfile to see if it exists */
00350     if( ( tst_entry_src = cache_inode_lookup( src_entry,
00351                                               &oldname, 
00352                                               &attr_tst_src, 
00353                                               data->ht, 
00354                                               data->pclient, 
00355                                               data->pcontext, 
00356                                               &cache_status ) ) == NULL )
00357       {
00358         res_RENAME4.status = nfs4_Errno( cache_status ) ;
00359         return res_RENAME4.status ;
00360       }
00361 
00362 
00363     /* Lookup file with new name to see if it already exists,
00364      * I expect to get NO_ERROR or ENOENT, anything else means an error */
00365     tst_entry_dst = cache_inode_lookup( dst_entry, 
00366                                         &newname, 
00367                                         &attr_tst_dst, 
00368                                         data->ht, 
00369                                         data->pclient, 
00370                                         data->pcontext, 
00371                                         &cache_status ) ;
00372     if( ( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) && ( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_NOT_FOUND ) )
00373       {
00374         /* Unexpected status at this step, exit with an error */
00375         res_RENAME4.status = nfs4_Errno ( cache_status ) ;
00376         return res_RENAME4.status ;
00377       }
00378  
00379    if( cache_status == CACHE_INODE_NOT_FOUND )
00380       tst_entry_dst = NULL ; /* Just to make sure */
00381    
00382     /* Renaming a file to one of its own hardlink is allowed, return NFS4_OK */
00383     if( tst_entry_src == tst_entry_dst )
00384       {
00385         res_RENAME4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00386         return res_RENAME4.status ;
00387       } 
00388 
00389     /* Renaming dir into existing file should return NFS4ERR_EXIST */
00390     if( ( (  tst_entry_src->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING ) || ( tst_entry_src->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE ) ) &&
00391         ( ( tst_entry_dst != NULL ) && ( tst_entry_dst->internal_md.type == REGULAR_FILE ) ) )
00392        {
00393          res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_EXIST ;
00394          return res_RENAME4.status ;
00395        }
00396 
00397     /* Renaming file into existing dir should return NFS4ERR_EXIST */
00398     if( tst_entry_src->internal_md.type == REGULAR_FILE ) 
00399       {
00400         if( tst_entry_dst != NULL ) 
00401           {
00402              if( ( tst_entry_dst->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING ) || ( tst_entry_dst->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE ) )
00403                {
00404                  res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_EXIST ;
00405                  return res_RENAME4.status ;
00406                }
00407           }
00408       }
00409 
00410     /* Renaming dir1 into existing, nonempty dir2 should return NFS4ERR_EXIST
00411      * Renaming file into existing, nonempty dir should return NFS4ERR_EXIST */
00412     if( tst_entry_dst != NULL )
00413       {
00414         if(  (  ( tst_entry_dst->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING ) || ( tst_entry_dst->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE ) ) &&
00415              ( (  tst_entry_src->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING ) || ( tst_entry_src->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE ) || 
00416                ( tst_entry_src->internal_md.type == REGULAR_FILE ) ) )
00417           {
00418              if( cache_inode_is_dir_empty_WithLock( tst_entry_dst ) == CACHE_INODE_DIR_NOT_EMPTY )
00419                {
00420                  res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_EXIST ;
00421                  return res_RENAME4.status ;
00422                }
00423           } 
00424       }
00425 
00426     /* Client cache coherency information */
00427     memset( &(res_RENAME4.RENAME4res_u.resok4.source_cinfo.before), 0, sizeof( changeid4) ) ;
00428     memset( &(res_RENAME4.RENAME4res_u.resok4.source_cinfo.after), 0, sizeof( changeid4) ) ;
00429 
00430     res_RENAME4.RENAME4res_u.resok4.source_cinfo.before = (changeid4)src_entry->internal_md.mod_time ;
00431     res_RENAME4.RENAME4res_u.resok4.target_cinfo.before = (changeid4)dst_entry->internal_md.mod_time ;
00432 
00433     if( cache_status == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00434       {
00435         /* New entry already exists, its attributes are in attr_tst_*, check for old entry to see if types are compatible */
00436         handlenew = cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( tst_entry_dst, &cache_status ) ;
00437         if( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) 
00438           {
00439             /* Unexpected status at this step, exit with an error */
00440             res_RENAME4.status = nfs4_Errno ( cache_status ) ;
00441             return res_RENAME4.status ;
00442           }
00443 
00444         handleold = cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( tst_entry_src, &cache_status ) ;
00445         if( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) 
00446         {
00447           /* Unexpected status at this step, exit with an error */
00448              res_RENAME4.status = nfs4_Errno ( cache_status ) ;
00449              return res_RENAME4.status ;
00450         }
00451         
00452 
00453         if( FSAL_handlecmp( handlenew, handleold, &fsal_status ) )
00454           {    
00455             /* For the change_info4, get the 'change' attributes for both directories */
00456             res_RENAME4.RENAME4res_u.resok4.source_cinfo.before = (changeid4)src_entry->internal_md.mod_time ;
00457             res_RENAME4.RENAME4res_u.resok4.target_cinfo.before = (changeid4)dst_entry->internal_md.mod_time ;
00458             res_RENAME4.RENAME4res_u.resok4.target_cinfo.atomic = TRUE ;
00459             res_RENAME4.RENAME4res_u.resok4.source_cinfo.atomic = TRUE ;
00460 
00461             res_RENAME4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00462             return NFS4_OK ;
00463           }
00464         else
00465           {
00466             res_RENAME4.status = NFS4ERR_EXIST ;
00467             return NFS4ERR_EXIST ;
00468           }        
00469       }
00470     else
00471       {
00472         /* New entry does not already exist, call cache_entry_rename */
00473         if( cache_inode_rename( src_entry, 
00474                                 &oldname,
00475                                 dst_entry, 
00476                                 &newname,
00477                                 &attr_src,
00478                                 &attr_dst,
00479                                 data->ht,
00480                                 data->pclient,
00481                                 data->pcontext,
00482                                 &cache_status )  != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00483           {
00484             res_RENAME4.status = nfs4_Errno ( cache_status ) ;
00485             return res_RENAME4.status ;
00486           }
00487       }
00488     
00489       
00490         
00491     /* If you reach this point, then everything was alright */
00492     /* For the change_info4, get the 'change' attributes for both directories */
00493     res_RENAME4.RENAME4res_u.resok4.source_cinfo.before = (changeid4)src_entry->internal_md.mod_time ;
00494     res_RENAME4.RENAME4res_u.resok4.target_cinfo.before = (changeid4)dst_entry->internal_md.mod_time ;
00495     res_RENAME4.RENAME4res_u.resok4.target_cinfo.atomic = TRUE ;
00496     res_RENAME4.RENAME4res_u.resok4.source_cinfo.atomic = TRUE ;
00497     res_RENAME4.status = nfs4_Errno( cache_status ) ;
00498     
00499     return res_RENAME4.status;
00500 } /* nfs4_op_rename */
00501

00503     
00514 void nfs4_op_rename_Free( RENAME4res * resp )
00515 {
00516   /* Nothing to be done */
00517   return ;
00518 } /* nfs4_op_rename_Free */

Generated on Wed Apr 9 08:24:29 2008 for NFS and Mount protocols layer by  1.3.9.1
